criteria: Understanding of Marginal Benefit and Marginal Cost
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of opportunity cost.
Student shows a limited understanding of opportunity cost, with significant inaccuracies.
Student identifies opportunity cost but struggles to apply it in real-world scenarios.
Student accurately defines opportunity cost and provides a basic example.
Student clearly explains opportunity cost and provides relevant examples, demonstrating a good understanding.
Student comprehensively explains opportunity cost, provides nuanced examples, and analyzes its implications in complex situations.
Student demonstrates no understanding of marginal benefit and marginal cost.

Student identifies marginal benefit and marginal cost but struggles to differentiate between them.
Student accurately defines marginal benefit and marginal cost and provides a basic example of each.
Student clearly explains marginal benefit and marginal cost, provides relevant examples, and demonstrates an understanding of their relationship.
Student comprehensively explains marginal benefit and marginal cost, provides nuanced examples, analyzes their relationship, and discusses how they inform decision-making.

Student applies economic reasoning in a limited way, with some inconsistencies.

Student effectively uses economic reasoning to analyze situations and make informed decisions.
Student skillfully uses economic reasoning to analyze complex situations, evaluate different perspectives, and make well-supported recommendations.
